channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [ROO-2508] @Rooplural annotation prevents "list all entity" option from showing in the menu
item.description:
When a @Rooplural is added to an entity the "list all entity" option from the navigation menu of the app isn't displayed, that means that the corresponding item in menu.jspx for list the item isn't added. This seems to be a Roo issue since it happens with recently created projects where no configuration file was changed manually.

In the original thread on the forum I reported the issue for version 1.1.3 but recently I confirmed that the 1.1.4 version has the same problem. I don't know if the usage of @Rooplural was changed in recent versions but in the documentation I don't found anything.

Thanks for all, regards.
item.summary: @Rooplural annotation prevents "list all entity" option from showing in the menu

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
I had done more tests and it seems that if I begin the value of the annotation with an uppercase letter the option is showed on the menu:
@Rooplural("roles") //this doesn't work
@Rooplural("Roles") //this works
But a problem persists, if I add the @Rooplural after the controllers were created then the default plural is showed in the menu instead the value passed to @Rooplural. For example for my entity "Rol" the default plural is "Rols" but I want "Roles" but when I add the annotation after the controller creation the menu item displays "Rols". The problem doesn't occur if I add the annotation before the controller creation.
Also, It's seems to me a little random the fist letter uppercase thing, I hadn't seen any documentation about formating rules for the a annotation or something similar.

Thanks for keeping track of my problem. Regards

This appears to be a bug in the newly introduced decorator matching algorithms introduced in Roo 1.1.3. More specifically the count method and the findAll method loose their tags if the @RooPlural annotation contains lower cased names, causing the MVC addons to drop the generation of certain methods and the relevant menu item. This also affects the integration test infrastructure (and presumably GWT).

Assigning to James as discussed.

Maybe a temporary fix would be to scan for the presence of @RooPlural annotations in CustomDataKeyDecoratorImpl. This would avoid the otherwise direct dependency on between plural addon and classpath bundles. This should be ok for Roo 1.1.5. For Roo 1.2.x we should consider either moving the plural handling closer to custom data processing or move custom data processing somewhere else so it can use the plural add-on.

Hey Xavier, the problem was that the plural is being capitalized in EntityMetadata but not in MethodMatcher. This has been fixed in commit 8b30453b410365404bd6c9ccd5d96157479f1ea1 with MethodMatcher capitalizing plurals.

I am not too sure what you mean by "But a problem persists, if I add the @Rooplural after the controllers were created then the default plural is showed in the menu instead the value passed to @Rooplural. For example for my entity "Rol" the default plural is "Rols" but I want "Roles" but when I add the annotation after the controller creation the menu item displays "Rols". The problem doesn't occur if I add the annotation before the controller creation.", so I am passing this one back to Stefan for follow up.

I just verified that James fix solves the problem.

Note that if you change Plural values via the @RooPlural annotation after the a Web UI has been generated for this entity, the menu labels will not be updated. This is by design to give you more predictability that Roo won't change most artifacts in your project (with the exception of ITDs, jspx and some GWT artifacts). So to change labels once Roo has set them up you need to adjust them accordingly in application.properties.
